title: So Sylas can absob magic
body:
So sylas can absorb magic huh? so does that mean he has limit or not? if the frejlord skin is canon does that mean he can absorb any kind of magic like annie fire magic and veigar dark magic?
 
p.s im just confused how his powers work
(thanks for answering my question im such a derp)

replies.body:
He can most certainly absorb annie's fire magic. If he can take up magic to survive touching true ice, then annie's fire is no issue.

Veigar's (or any yordle for that matter) magic I doubt there is any way to confirm/disprove it.
Yordle magic is different to human magic and so it may act differently.


My question is what happens with people like ryze or brand, who essentially ARE magic. 

I would also be interested in void magic or ascended magic from darkins or maybe targonians.

If Sylas becomes Iceborn when he touches an iceborn, the only logical conclusion is that... If Sylas touches a yordle HE BECOMES A YORDLE.

100% Canon.

But in all seriousness, i guess he would have problems with yordle magic since Poppy doesnt seem to be bothered by the petricite of Demacia.

He can take ascended magic. In the comics, he is able to absorb and use Morgana's chains to bound, I think, Jarvan IV. Void magic is currently unknown if he could. Void magic is completely different to other magic because Runeterra magic has a thing of life to it, Void magic hungers for life in order to live (to fit with the theme of the hunger from the void champions). 

Ryze and Brand wouldn't be any different to normal mages. All he has to do is 1) touch them or 2) come in contact with someone / something that has been recently affected by their spells, unless that something is petricite because that stuff holds magic for a long, long time, or 3) be hit by their magic. We know it does because Sylas' revolution takes place a long time after the time of Kayle and Morgana, but he could still use Morgana's magic.

Sylas was the first champion I got to work on and as is traditional I brought too much ambition and caused a lot of confusion. Sorry internet u_u

Sylas himself _can't_ absorb magic but he _is_ a mage in that he can use/channel magic. Unfortunately he's been locked into some pretty cruel manacles that just happen to be really good at stopping magic creatures. His restraints are made of a material called Petricite that ancient Demacians invented, basically concrete made from ancient trees that were thought to **nullify** all magic (if you've seen One Piece they are like the Seastone Handcuffs).

But here's the secret to Sylas' power: he has discovered that Petricite doesn't nullify magic but absorbs it. It drinks in all magic voraciously, causing mages to fall to their knees in pain as their power is drained away, but then stores it like a battery. What's more is he has learned how to release it! He's no trained wizard; he can't shape it into complex spells but instead unleashes all that stored magic that's been drained from his body in chaotic bursts.

TL;DR The petricite manacles absorb all forms of magic with seemingly limitless voracity. Sylas is the only mage who has learned how to release it again!

But in his Bio says:

> "When he tried to shield the child from the mageseekers, he accidentally brushed against her skin. The girl’s magic rushed through Sylas’s body—but rather than killing him, it shot forth from his hands in raw, uncontrolled bursts. It was a talent he did not know he possessed, and it resulted in the deaths of three people, including his mageseeker mentor."

If he can't absorb magic, what was that?

Channelling, or more he's a conduit. Magic passes through him.

Absorbing means it stays in the thing. All Sylas did was redirect it. The little girl he took if from has control of that magic so she can hold it in, Sylas can't.

Great answer! I think Sylas' innate power as a mage is fairly support-based, he can sense/see it and manipulate it's flow. The same power to redirect her magic allows him to unspool it from the petricite.

> It drinks in all magic voraciously, causing mages to fall to their knees in pain as their power is drained away, but then stores it like a battery. 

Are you sure about the pain bit? I know drinking Petricite elixirs/potions causes pain to mages, but for example, in Flesh and Stone, Lux touched Petricite and didnt feel pain:
> Lux approached the plinth where the colossus stood, all alone in the stillness of night. She cautiously placed her hand on the cold petricite foundation. Wonder what it tastes like. I bet it’s really bitter, she reckoned. She supposed she would find out soon enough, unless her plan worked.

And Sylas isnt in constant pain just by wearing the shackles(and they do absorb his magic since he lost part of his magical sigth on prision, he just absorbs it back). And it makes sense that Petricite elixirs would hurt since well, you're basically drinking concrete.

So can you clarify? Petricite absorbing magic making mages feel pain doesnt seem to fit what the lore currently says, save for potions.

Also what do you exactly mean when saying he cant absorb magic? In Demacian Heart he seemed to pretty clearly absorb a girl's magic   without Petricite even if he couldnt keep it for long: 
> The boy rushed toward the girl, throwing himself between the heavy quarterstaff and the flaring streams of light. The hairs on his arms singed and his fingers blistered as he touched the little mage.
> 
> A twisting arc of lightning pierced his hand, and a blazing current rushed through his flesh, contorting his entire body. The boy's heart clenched and all the air inside him rushed out. He gasped for breath but drew only emptiness.
> ...
> His heart raced, pumping a numbing calmness throughout his body. The blaze inside him remained, but no longer threatened to consume him. Instead, it flowed calmly throughout, and for the briefest moments it felt malleable to his thoughts. Then it suddenly sparked and flared hotter until he could no longer contain it inside.
> 
> Light erupted from his hands, and the world disappeared.
> 
> Sylas opened his eyes. Three smoldering husks lay strewn on the scorched ground. One of them held a warped and splintered staff in hand. The other two had fallen near each other, their arms splayed and reaching, but forever apart.

You're right in that story it seems like Lux is fine. But the potent and ancient manacles Sylas wears are very pure and do indeed cause him constant pain.

In 'Shackles of Belief' there's a great description of what it's like to be Sylas;
> Thorva jerked back in shock, but she was too slow. The man tore off one of his gloves and grabbed her by the arm, and even as Thorva tried to summon her gods-given power, she felt it ripped out of her, forcibly drained from the core of her being. Her body was stricken with a sudden, incapacitating coldness—a sensation she had not felt in years—and she fell, unable to breathe, unable to move, unable to do anything.

The intention in his backstory was to allude to an ability to manipulate magic, but the way the manacles absorb and hold it is something he couldn't do without them. He can control the course of a river but can't stop the flow - the petricite is the dam if that makes sense.
So essentially, Sylas isn’t an Iceborne now like we thought? He needs a constant supply to tap into to live in the north and fight?

Yeah stealing someone's magic doesn't make you an Iceborn (it's in the name _born_). That power comes from within. He can syphon it off and use it for a time but the victim will recover and his stolen magic will deplete. Now he _could_ bring a mage with him and just constantly drain their magic, but it would be a bit hypocritical of him to do that where potential allies could see.

The way Sylas' magic works is that if his shackles touch a source of magic, they absorb the magic and allow Sylas to draw from it until the magic runs out. 

If he simply touches a mage, he can take their power. This is why when he grabbed Lux's hand in the comic, he gained Light magic to blast his way of his cage. 

It is also why whenever he touches petricite (Demacian stone), he takes the magic that the stone holds. 

So, if he simply came into contact with Veigar or Annie, he could easily take their magic.

I just read the Lux comic yesterday, from what I understood it is the material his gauntlets/chains are made from, it 'drinks in' any form of magic it comes into contact with, he learned how to use this from the scroll detailing how Galio works. I don't think we know if there are any exceptions to this, as in, are there certain forms of magic he wouldn't be able to use? Sylas's innate ability as a mage is to sense magic and what type it is in others, this certainly synergizes with the gauntlets as it allows him to learn maybe what he can and can't absorb, or how much he can asborb from certain people/locations/beings.

To clarify none of the skins are canon in League of Legends lore. They are what if variants, like what if Ahri was in a modern school.

But yes Sylas can absorb magic, we do not know of a limit as of now.

This is true for most of the skins in the game, but there are a few exceptions. Captain Fortune is MF's current canon form, Gangplank was Captain Gangplank in the past, and Sylas' freljord skin is indeed what he looks like right now as he's in the Freljord.

The actual sylas freljord skin is very very canon, linking both lux comic and sylas story and biography. In the lux comic sylas escaped and used one of the secret tunnel under demacia to escape the kingdom, in the biography in the end it’s said that he went to freljord to absorb the true ice magic and get allies, and in his story he effectively meet the members of sejuani’s faction and absorbs the true ice magic. This might be the first of a series of canon skins that will come out
In the recent Warriors video Sylas was leading a group of Winter's Claw against a Demacian outpost too.

Sylas I see him is like a battery. He can recharge by touching a mage with his body or his gauntlets. Sylas can only use the magic until he runs out of their magic. Sylas if he was able to get into contact with them he would be able to use their magic but he doesn't keep it which is why you don't see him using Lux's spark magic when hes in the Freljord. Also if he does have a limit we haven't seen it yet Im assuming if he used World Runes he wouldn't be able to contain that magic without changing in appearance like Brand

As far as we know he can absorb and use any kind of magic.(though otherworldly magic like the void might be an exception)
However his own ability to hold onto it is quite limited, which is why he still uses his petricite shackles as they absorb magic too and hold onto it, meaning that they pretty much act like batteries for him.

I wonder if he absorbs enough magic if he begins to inflate like a balloon. Oh lord that sounds so hot! A bunch of female mages led by Lux chaining him up and force feeding him magic until he's as big as the room!

Technically, it's the petricite gauntlets he wears that can absorb magic.

While he was imprisoned, Sylas figured out a way to draw energy out of it and use it.
Hes kinda like rouge from xmen
